replies.body:
I genuinely have to ask how people are getting hit by his ult (mostly in the laning phase, unless you're chasing him then its understandable)

I say this because its telegraphed four seconds in advance, which means you need to be standing where Ekko was 4 seconds ago (which is visible to you via his time-clone), it would certainly depend on the matchup but it confounds me how Ekko would even get anywhere close to you without eating significant amounts of poke.

TL;DR: I can't understand how people get hit by his ult (mostly in the laning phase), when its as simple as avoiding the time-clone, which exists 4 seconds in the past. Unlike alot of ults which can vary in use, Ekko literally can't use his ult to hurt you, unless you go near his clone (which is completely within your control)


Edit: on a side note, wouldn't he suffer from the issue Talon has, where he can get in easily (dash in and then teleport onto you) but can't get out easily? (Bear in mind most problem assassins have a way in AND a way out incase things turn bad, Zed has his second shadow; LeBlanc can teleport back to her glyph, Kassadin has riftwalk, etc; Ekko has none of that, he has to walk away with a short speed boost, thats just asking to get CC'd at point blank range the moment he engages)

3 ways I've landed his ulti in lane phase

Recall next to turret, enemy comes for farm and doesn't expect you to R return, they also don't always see it right away. (same goes using bushes)

Duel, Ekko does not duel very well, but if you don't kill him in 4 seconds guess what :D
Same goes for if you fight without moving much. If you enemy EVER engages on you, you can land it.

Zone. Place a stun in front of them, dash behind them and land Q. They have limited options for escape, chances are they have to walk through one of you zoning skills. (about 50/50, 75/25 if you used terrain or minion waves to your advantage)

Bonus, land your stun LOL that's different because it's harder to land than the ulti, but if he's stunned you, good chance he's ulti u too :)

And like you mentioned, if you're chasing him, but that's your greed, not his OP :P
In a teamfight, a lot can happen. So, it's also understandable why you would get hit by his ult. The fact that it ALSO has the utility of a teleport to your point of recall is pretty strong.

Yeah I should've elaborated (will probably do so after this post) I was mostly referring to the laning phase, since thats where assassin's usually become make or break. Ekko's cost on his Q is too high for him to reliably spam it for farming (without blue anyway), and he lacks a shield like Diana's without using his highly telegraphed W.

It seems like he'd again be like Talon and just have a terrible laning phase, only it'd be even harder for Ekko to snowball since his things are all so telegraphed.
His Q is approximately as telegraphed as Ori's or Ziggs's. It also gives good waveclear. I wouldn't call him anywhere near helpless in lane.

Don't misunderstand, I'm not calling him helpless, his Q has a pretty high cost though (it would be like Talon trying to spam rake to farm; he can do it, but he runs out of mana quickly)

I just think Ekko is going to be one of those people who has SO much counterplay, that it hurts his consistency in the end.

I could end up being completely wrong and he'll end up ridiculously overpowered, but I suppose time will tell. When I said his "things" were telegraphed by the way, I was mostly referring to his W and R, not Q, W takes 3 seconds to activate, in which time the enemy has likely walked back under their turret (making diving without an escape somewhat risky).

And R is well, R, 4 second delay with a telegraphed location and all that jazz.

>but I suppose time will tell
